column1: nicely tossed up on a good length at off stump, stretches forward and pushes with the spin towards long-on
pushed flat, back of a length on the pads, tucked away to deep midwicket

tossed up again, slightly fuller this time and he's beaten him flight. Attempts the sweep but it's too full. It bounces away slowly to Boland and should not have been any runs,instead, Boland lets it right through him at short fine
short on off stump, back foot punch straight to covers
short on middle stump, pushes back and slams it past the bowler off the back foot. Long-on can't get to it
flat on a good length at middle, tries to make room and punch into the off side, but gets a thick inside edge to the open infield on the leg side
full on middle, looking for swing, there isn't any. There is an immediate threat to his shin though as the batsman stands in his crease and swings hard at it and it's four past mid-on
good length on middle, holds his ground again, frees up his arms and this time he hits it over the bowler
back of a length on off, tucks him up, but he gets bat on it and pushes to point off the back foot
good length on the pads, tries to glance it fine but doesn't make connection
good length on leg stump, raps him on the pads as he tries to turn it into the leg side. Loud appeal from the bowler, but that pitched way outside
back of a length on the pads, pushed off the back foot to the right of short fine
full on middle, gets forward and uses his wrists to place it between long-on and deep midwicket
full on middle, this time he uses soft hands, so long-on has to run in a long way. Skillful batting.
good length on middle, tries to push with soft hands again, but this time the fielder has run in rapidly and keeps it to a single
full toss on the pads, flicked straight to square leg
good length on the pads, gets on his knee and sweeps it past square leg
overpitched on leg stump, slammed past the bowler and long-on has to hurry to his right to cut this off
good length, angling across the left hander on middle, pushed to short midwicket

back of a length angling across off stump, gets a little higher than the previous ball, and his attempted half-forward slog is only a top edge in the end for mid-on to catch easily in front of his eyes
back of a length, angling across off stump, gets on his toes and drops it into the off side with soft hands
short and wide, but comes in with the angle and eventually cramps the batsman who has tried to flay this over the off side infield
full outside off, angling in again. Moves across his stumps but ends up pushing feebly to covers for a single
full on off stump, gets a small stride in and drives gracefully, slightly to the right of mid-off. Pietersen gets across quickly and has a shy at the stump. Misses.
back of a length on middle, sits up for in-form Dunk, shifts his weight forward and pulls it to the right of deep square
good length, pushed across from off stump, he steps out and slices it uppishly to the left of third man
back of a length in the corridor, times his back foot punch well, but it is cut off by point
good length, slower ball of off stump, Dunk hasn't picked it. His eyes light up as he tries to cream this though cover but gets an inside edge that bounces over the stump
good length on off, angling slightly away, tries the pull again but this one was too full and goes knee-height past his stumps
slower ball again. Good length on off stump, he waits for it to deviate and tries to slap it off the front foot. Doesn't time it. Bounces slowly to the point fielder
he's picked up on Boland's angle. Good length, coming in towards off, he shuffles across, takes a step forward and lifts it with the angle over midwicket
short and wide. Really wide. He throws his bat at it with a cut shot, but it hits the bottom and goes to mid-off
back of a length, flying over off stump. Dunk has tried another pull shot, but this one is too big on him, and one hand comes off the bat, baseball style
good length on middle, tapped to mid-on
slower ball on off stump, steps across his stumps again and pulls it without too much timing to deep square
good length on the pads, stays put, waits for it to come to him, and turns it away off his hips
tossed up on middle, paddle sweep comes out, straight to short fine
tossed up on middle again, tries to slog this out of the ground, but gets a thick inside edge down to long-on
flighted up on off stump, smashed back past him to long-off
tossed up slightly wide of off stump, he steps out slightly to get to it  and lifts it over covers
flighted outside off, driven past covers

Potter's conjured something! Dunk is his first wicket. Tosses it up nicely on off stump, Dunk sees it flighted and his hands get hard. Doesn't get to the pitch as he tries to flay this over covers and it bobs up towards the fielder, who takes a couple of step backwards and times his jump to perfection
yorker on off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length on off, steps out, makes a bit of room and places it to third man
114 kph, a fast offspinner, good length on off stump. He pushes it to midwicket and Hussey has a shy. Might have been close if he hit
short and sliding down the leg, past Hodge's attempted glance to fine leg
short and angling in again, this one also beats Hodge's glance, and hits him in the mid-riff
back of a length outside off, walks across his stumps and tries to pull it. Gets it high on his bat
slower bouncer outside off, Hodge gets into a hook and tries to withdraw at the last moment, but it hits his bat as it's coming down. Thankfully for him, straight down into the pitch
flighted outside off, this looks like a wrong'un. Doesn't get to the pitch, tries to slam it past cover but gets an outside edge for short third man to clean up
full on middle stump, pushed down to long-on
tossed up on off stump, steps out and drives it to sweeper cover
good length, flighted nicely on middle stump, and it's another wrong'un. Pushed off the front foot with soft hands
full on off stump, makes room and drives it to long-off
flighted outside off, driven down to long-off
good length outside off, opens the face, plays away from the body, runs it down to third man
short outside off, helped down to third man
short outside off, gives him the charge and tries to slog it over midwicket. Inside edge and to the left of the keeper
good length, angled into the pads, helped down to fine leg
short in the corridor, cramps him for room, but he gets on top and opens his face to guide it down to third man
slower ball, short outside off, tries to run it down to third man but he's beaten by the slight away deviation
flat on leg stump, blocked back to the bowler
a little slower, on off stump. Presses forward, waits, and dabs towards point
fired in full at the pads. Ends up as a low full-toss, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length, on the stumps, not much turn so Hodge is cramped up while trying to make room. Can't hit through the off side, punches back to the bowler instead
a little more flight, off-stump line, steered with an open face to point off the front foot
slow again, angling into middle stump, lap-swept into the short fine-leg region
down the track and Hilfenhaus slows it down, looks like the legcutter release. Angles it in to deny room. Skips away from the line and bunts into the covers
short on off stump. Hodge steps away from the line, can't make enough room to slap through the off side, flat-bats to mid-on instead

short again, angles into Hodge even as he tries to move away towards the leg side to make room. Hits high on the bat as he tries to pull, and loops into unguarded territory 20 yards from the midwicket boundary
bouncer, the umpire calls wide for height as Hodge leaves it
slower short ball, pulled to deep square leg
short again, on off stump, flat-batted to long-on
Back of a length and into the body, pulled through square leg
tossed up wide outside off, left alone and it's called wide
fired across full, swiped to long-on
back of a length outside off, looks to cut, bottom-edges towards short third man
down the track, gets too close to the pitch for elevation, hits it one-bounce to long-on
flat on off stump, flat-batted to long-off
flat and quick on the pads. Late on the pull and it runs away off the pad into the fine-leg region
floated up slow outside off, stabbed to point
Strikes first ball of new spell. Full and straight, Hodge slogs across the line and misses and this crashes into the middle of leg stump
slower short ball on off stump, steps across to work it to long leg
slower bouncer outside off. Rises over Ludeman's head as he steps out and he aborts the initially intended pull
gone. Two in four balls. Slower ball, fairly full. Steps out, hits through the line, strikes it fairlt well, but can't get enough power into the shot to clear long-on
back of a length outside off, Pollard pokes into the cover point region
length ball on off stump, blocked into the covers
back of a length, angling into middle stump, steps across and tucks this wide of midwicket
floated up slow outside off, blocked to short cover
quicker, flatter, angling down leg. Can't connect with the flick, and the ball runs into the leg side off the front pad

down the track, and that really shouldn't count as a drop. Drilled back with so much power, at hip height, and Beer jumps to his left to get out of the way, and maybe make room to get a hand in. Whizzed past before he could do that
full outside off, drilled hard to straight mid-off, and they manage a single despite the ball reaching the fielder at the speed of ... the average Pollard hit
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
makes a bit of room this time as Beer hits that back-of-a-length spot again, punches to cover, another dot
length ball close to off, punched into the mid-on region
slower ball, back of a length, lots of bottom hand as Dean swats this to long-on
back of a length, angling into the  body, whipped to the right of midwicket
slower ball, but it's too full, and gives too much width, Dean relieves some pressure by placing his drive nicely to the right of the diving short extra-cover fielder
shortish outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
yorker on off stump, looked like some late outswing too. Jams down hurriedly to pick up a single towards mid-on
shortish, rising stomach-high and angling in all the time. Cramps up Pollard, who inside-edges the attempted flick into his body
short outside off, seemed to read Pollard's intention of clearing his front leg and looking to hit down the ground. Ends up too far from the ball and beaten
short, angling into the body, drags his pull to fine leg
back of a length, angling into leg stump, and that's adroitly done. If he meant it. Made room to dab into the off side, ends up inside-edging very fine, to the fine leg boundary
shot. Saw Dean making room and banged it in short, looking to deny him room. Doesn't angle it as acutely as he'd have liked, and Dean lets it come, leans back, and ramps it to the right of the keeper
full on off stump, jabbed to mid-off
full on middle and leg, chipped on the bounce to the right of long-on
slower ball, back of a length outside off, pulled to midwicket. Has to hurry to reach the other end but the throw is slightly off-target, from David Hussey
low full-toss on off and middle, and that is middled all right. Makes room, clears his front leg, and just shovels it over the top, easily clears Quiney leaping on the rope at long-on

shows his intentions too quickly. Jumps across, a la AB de Villiers, looking for the scoop over short fine leg. Does it too early and Boland bowls a slower ball wide of off. Can't change his shot quickly enough to connect
shortish outside off, looks to pull, can't quite middle it. He's slightly late on it, ends up hitting from down to up, and scoops a catch to the man on the square leg boundary

yorker close to off stump. Wants to make room and hit into the covers, can't find enough room and ends up sending the ball rolling down past the stumps at the other end. Quiney, sliding left from long-on, may not have kept it in properly. Yeah, foot touching rope
slanted across the left-hander, on a good-ish length. Looks to carve it through the covers, can't make contact
fuller along the same line, looks for the flat-bat squeeze through point, misses again
and gets him. Well bowled. Banged it in short, angled it across, made him pull against the angle. Can't connect well enough, hits high on the bat and loops up for a simple catch at mid-on

and again, slants it full and wide. Smith slashes and nicks through to the keeper. He was struggling against this angle of attack, clearing his front leg all the time, forgetting the old-fashioned art of getting his front foot across to get close to the line

full, big lbw appeal, not given. Looked to shuffle across the stumps and work it leg side. Hit him on the back leg. I'm not sure that pitched outside leg, Mr. Umpire! Hawkeye suggests it pitched well outside leg
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
Slower length ball wide of off, flat-batted to long-off
length ball, banged in harder outside off. Clears his front leg and doesn't middle his flat-bat hit. Skews it up in the air, on the bounce to the left of long-off

bouncer over middle stump, Sodhi misses the pull, and someone is run out! They looked to sneak a bye, and Handscomb had plenty of time to measure out an underarm flick at the batsman's end to catch Neser well short
full-toss on middle and leg, makes room to punch to sweeper cover

slower ball, doesn't miss off stump by much after Agar misses the slog. They manage to sneak a bye this time. Took longer to reach Handscomb, and he missed at the keeper's end and Stoinis missed at the bowler's end
another slower ball, on off stump, Sodhi sees it early and holds his shape, makes swinging room by clearing his front leg and swipes it away over the wide long-on boundary
good length, some shape, down the leg side
short and shaping into leg stump, sits up for him and Quiney smashes it behind square off the back foot
short on middle stump, this it is faster on him and he attempts the same shot, but it flies off the outside edge and goes through the slip cordon
good length, shaping in, down the leg side again
good length, angled across from middle stump, puts in a small stride and hits it on the up with the full face, straight over mid-off
short on leg, swings down the leg side
full on middle, Quiney looks for the same shape but it's straight this time and his attempte bunt into the leg side results in a leading edge to mid-off
good length on middle stump, angling in, defended off the front foot
full in the corridor, slight swing away, he pushes at it with hard hands, straight to covers
angled in on middle stump, good length, pushed into the leg side
stays around the wicekt. Floated on middle stump, good length, defended
angled across full on off stump, steps out and drives it hard, straight to the bowler
flighted on a good length at off stump, pushed into the off side off the front foot
floated up on middle stump, goes on with the arm, and gets the inside edge of Quiney who was down the track and trying to hit it over mid-off
picks the angle this time, steps down and hits it over mid-on. One bounce.
full toss on leg stump, driven to long-on
knee-high full toss on off stump, slogged away powerfully, but straight to deep midwicket
floated up on off stump, steps down the track, converts it into a full toss and slams it straight to long-on
drifted in towards middle stump on a good length, he steps down the track and lifts it nicely over the bowler
floated in on middle stump, tries to step out and push it into the leg side, but yorks himself and hits it straight back
floated on middle again, steps out again, yorks himself again, straight back to the bowler. Again.
short of a length, slightly outside off, gets in position quickly and pulls it through midwicket. Bit of Ponting to that shot, glorious
good length, angled in to the batsman, who is properly cramped for room and can't do much but stop it from hitting him
slower ball, short on off stump, bunted down to short third man
slower ball on off stump on a good length, opens the face and hits it to short third man
good length on off stump, another slower ball, tries to play a forward defense into covers, hits the inside half of the bat and goes to midwicket
slower ball again. Follows the batsman down the leg side, bowls it full, and Quiney tries to turn it into the leg side. Doesn't connect. Catches his pads and goes to short third man
angles into the pads from around the wicket, Quiney will sweep that for four whether he's in form or not. Swatted away over square leg who is inside the circle
full on middle, steps out and cramps himself, can only manage to drive it haphazardly to long-on

floats it on a good length on middle stump. Wright has gotten impatient after being tied up. He steps out, gets to the pitch and tries to hammer it over long-on, but doesn't get any elevation. Easy catch and Dunk has his first wicket at senior level limited-overs cricket
flighted and turning away from leg stump on a good length, Pietersen has to reach out to get bat and he does, through square leg
flighted on off stump, Pietersen has premeditated this scoop over short fine. Gets in position, waits for it, goes slightly across, and lifts if easily
full on leg stump, waits for it to land and jams it out, into the path of deep midwicket
111 kph, full slower ball floated on off stump, gets Piteresen pushing at it, but the leading edge is safe as it goes to covers
follows it up with a fast, straight, yorker. Flicked away from deep in the crease and square leg undoes the pressure with a careless misfield
slower ball, pitches on leg stump at a good length, grips and climbs past Quiney's attempted flick shot. Hits him in on the thigh

low full toss on leg stump, he hits it nervously in the air with no power, straight to long-on. That was strange from Quiney, he was either expecting a slower ball or wanted to hit that wider than it went
slower ball, good length, outside off. Forward defense

slower ball on outside off on a good length, Pietersen tries to force the pace and push this into the off side, but can't get it past the pitch. He's taken off for a single and has to scramble back as Laughlin tries to kick his stumps down with the ball
back of length, angled in to middle stump, makes room and chops it down to third man
back of a length outside off, tries to open the face, but hits it straight to point
rolls his fingers on this short and wide delivery, tries to cut it, inside edge on to the pad and rolls back to the bowler
short and wide, gets on top of it, shapes to cut, and rolls his wrists last minute to adjust for the slowness. One run to third man
full and outside off, clears the front foot and tries to slam it through the offisde, gets the lower half and it goes to mid-off

slower ball, back of a length on off stump, sits up for Piteresen who gets a trademark stride forward and across and swats it into the leg side. Pollard runs about ten yards and puts in a dive, but it goes through him at deep midwicket
good length on off stump, pushed through flat, forward defense

drifted into off stump on a good length, and holds its line to hit it! Handscomb plays a sweep to this, but it has gone straight through him. It didn't angle in enough for the sweep, nor did it give him the safety of turning away and missing the stumps. Good bowling.
good length on off stump, pushed off the front foot to covers
pushed flat on a good length outside off, swatted away to deep cover
drifted in towards off stump on a good length, no turn, pushed to short third man with an open face
94 kph, fired in full at middle stump, gets down on the front foot and pushes it back to the bowler
short and wide, he shapes up to dispatch this, but it has gripped and comes on slowly. He checks his shot, gets contorted as he does it. In the end, it's straight to point
short in the corridor, opens the face and runs it down to third man

that is ugly from Stoinis. Back of a length, angled down towards leg stump. Stoinis, has premeditated this. Steps out at it, gets himself tangled and tries a last minute hoick to clear mid-on. It gets the top of his bat and bobs up for the bowler to complete a straightforward catch
full and angled into the pads, pushed off the front foot to mid-on
back of a length outside off, sits up for him and he drags it into the leg side with a well-timed pull shot, deep midwicket runs to his left and cuts it off
short and wide, Pietersen gets pace on the ball this time, but his swipe at it doesn't connect. Goes a few centimeters past the wide marker and is called a wide
slower ball, back of a length, angled in towards off stump, sliced through the covers
floated on off stump and turns away. Pietersen expected it to drift in with pace, but is beaten at his premeditated sweep
good length, middle stump, googly. Pietersen tries to tuck it into the leg side and takes it on the pads. Loud appeal, sliding down
floated outside off, turns away and has him pushing at it
floats it full and wide outside off, he reaches out and gets no timing on his cover drive
drifted in on a good length at off stump, driven straight to covers
drops it short outside off, gets back and chops if past slip for four
back of a length slower ball on off stump, chopped to short third man
slower ball, full and angled into the pads, turned around with soft hands towards short fine
slower ball full on middle stump, walks across his stumps and pushes into the open leg side for an easy single
slower ball on the pads, gets forward and pushes it wide of long-on
good length on off stump, another slower ball, pushed to point off the front foot
slower ball, good length on middle stump, pushed straight to midwicket
pushed in flat and full on off stump, Hussey stays in his crease and gets under it. Lifts it over long-off who puts in a jump and just about misses it
fired in short on off stump, gets back and gets this pull shot right in the middle, but straight to short midwicket!
tossed up outside off, steps out and converts it into a full toss. Sliced to sweeper cover
good length on off stump, he gets down to play paddle sweep, contemplates a reverse sweep, sticks to the paddle sweep and gets one run after all of that
drifted in on off stump, good length, pitches and turns slightly. Past the outside edge.
drops it short on middle, pull shot straight to deep midwicket
99kph, slower yorker, looped outside off stump, jammed out towards point who misfields
floated full outside off, Pieteresen wants to slam this through the offside, but there isn't enough pace. Sliced aerially to sweeper cover
good length on off stump, bunted into the off side

good length on off stump, Pietersen gives the charge, steps across and drag-flicks it to the leg side. The long-on fielder has gone for the catch and it seems like the wrong option. He can't get to it with a full length forward dive and it's four
good length on off stump, sliced past a wide short third man
walks across the stumps again. Good length on off stump, flicks it wide of long-on
pushed flat on a good length at middle stump, opens the face and guides it to short third man
floated on off stump, steps out and hits it on the full to long-off
floated on middle, steps out and whips it on the full, but hits it too well and it's only a single to long-on
cancel what I said about Gulbis and singles. This one is angled in on off stump at a good length, and he gets down on his knee and bisects deep midwicket and long-on

fired in on middle stump, pushed away with soft hands into the open leg side. They scramble for the second, Sodhi has gotten across and thrown it to Hodge at the non-strikers end. It has been referred to the third umpire. AND IT LOOKS OUT! Pietersen is short of his crease! Big wicket for the Strikers! Sodhi can do no wrong. We're in for a finish now!
pushed flat outside off on a good length, and he leaves it alone

good length on off, opens the face and hits it straight to short third man. He has run without calling or taking a look at his partner and is halfway down the crease when the fielder fumbles. Safe. For now.
back of a length in the corridor, lets it go
slower ball outside off, clears his front foot and slaps it past mid-off who is in close to stop the single
leg cutter on off stump, deviates away from a good length and beats the outside edge
full and angled into the pads, pushed off the front foot to long-on

short and wide, gets under it and chops it sweetly over point. Third man runs some twenty yards and puts in a great dive, but his momentum means he can only push the ball to his right and it touches the rope
good length outside off, tails in slightly and catches the inside of the bat as he tries to smash it on the up through covers. Straight back to the bowler
short and wide, slower ball, tries to cut it hard but it balloons and falls short of mid-off
back of a length in the corridor, opens the face and hits it straight to short third man
back of a length, angles it in outside off at a chest height and it's too close for his attempted cut. Beaten.
slower ball short of a length outside off, he gives him the charge, closes his eyes, swings at it and hopes for the best. In this case, the best is that it has gone over off stump
slower ball, good length outside off, slogs it wide of long-on with minimal timing
full slower ball on middle stump, chips it to long-on's right
109 kph, slower ball, limbs from a good length outside off. Gets it high on the bat as he opens the face. Short third man and point are happy to give him a single
slower ball outside off, steps down and misses the slog
slower ball outside off, stays back this time and swats it to sweeper cover
135 kph, yorker tailed in at leg stump, cramps him for room and he can only slice it to deep cover
in the block hole on middle stump, excellent delivery. He hits it straight back to the bowler who slips as he tries to field that and misfields
slower ball, good length, outside off. He finally connects! Steps out and smashes it past the bowler's left boot
good length slower ball outside off, steps out again and hits it wide of long-on
slower ball again, back of a length on middle. Steps out and connects his slog perfectly, and it's into the gap on the square leg boundary
good length, wide outside off stump, steps out and misses it this time
good length outside off, steps down the track and slaps it uppishly through covers
WOW! He steps down to a bouncer but it doesn't matter! Get's a fraction of room, and he has tennis smashed this straight over the bowler for six!
short and wide outside off, uses his wrists and cuts it wide of sweeper cover
BEAUTY! 112 kph, full slower ball on off stump and Gulbis has not picked this. He plays for line and tries to turn it down to fine leg but it has gone under his bat and clips off stump
yorker on the pads, tries to flick this but it raps him on the boot and runs away past Sodhi at short fine
full and fired in on middle stump, just about converts it into a full toss and flicks it through square on leg side
full on the pads, flicked away to deep midwicket

It has worked! he brings the field in, tempts Boland to make room and swipe it through the off side, but he's just not that good! Perfect yorker on middle stump and it's a beautiful sight as the bails fly off
low full toss on off stump and he drives it to mid-off
full toss on the pads and he turns it away easily to fine leg. Poor bowling that.
good length, angled into the pads, and he chips it through square leg and takes his team home
